instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_LSOC_RST_L: What is SMC_LSOC_RST_L? SMC_LSOC_RST_L is a signal that comes out of the trackpad on Macbook Airs that can reset the SMC.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B keyboard start problem
threads.message:
Hello

I'm working on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B board was liquid damaged around trackpad (board is looking totally clean) Computer can not starting from keyboard but if battery not connected when plug magsafe adapter starts(its normal i know)  and works normally . When touch power button ( not long press only one sec is) computer stop working and totally dead ( not magsafe led or any sign of working).

Tried knows good keyboard, trackpad, trackpad flex,battery and I/O board nothing changed.

<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3V and when battery connected short it to ground doesn't start computer ( normally must be start) also replaced SMC nothing change...

Note: When start computer plug magsafe cable without battery; if you press power button computer stops 1 second and start again him self.

Any idea for check next step

Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B keyboard start problem
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL> is being pulled down. So corrosion around <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> or trackpad connector. If that is clean it MUST be the trackpad or flat cable or both.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B keyboard start problem
threads.message: Thank you very much Duke. After replace track pad connector from board side problem solved.
